attributes.action: Reinstate teacher recommended A level & GCSE grades.
attributes.additional_details:
This year, almost 40% of A-level grades predicted by teachers have been downgraded by OFQUAL.

Those from disadvantaged or poor socio-ecomonic backrounds have been hit the worst by a biased algorithm which inadvertently favours the privileged.

A further 2 million teacher-recommended GCSE grades are expected to be downgraded. Several young people's  futures will be severly impacted by this unfairness. 

We call upon the Minister of Education to reinstate the grades recommended by teachers.
attributes.background: Replace the A- level and GCSE results produced by Ofqual’s statistical mechanism and reinstate the grades recommended by teachers.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has announced that GCSE and A-level students will receive their centre assessment grades: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/gcse-and-a-level-students-to-receive-centre-assessment-grades

Prior to this announcement being made, we had published the following petitions, calling for similar actions to your request: 

Reverse all exam grades back to teacher’s own predictions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334491

Review the decision to use previous data to calculate exam grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306773

Allow free and accessible appeals of GCSE and A Level calculated grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334013
